Letter from Edgar Allan Poe to an unknown correspondent (fragment), 1836? Manuscript, Poe Museum, Richmond, Virginia

ber. there can be no impropriety in telling the commencement of Vol. 2. 1 The editorial have devolved upon myself, and you allude to are my own. I with your approbation of my labours. would be very glad to hear from you I believe you had some little acquain- other W.H.L. Poe 2 of Baltimore .
Very resp. Yr. Ob. S t Edgar A. Poe
